Interface Tile

All Known Implementing Classes:
HexagoTile, SquareTile
public sealed interface Tile permits HexagoTile, SquareTile
Represents a tile in the game board. Tiles can be Hexagonal or Square and are used to place animals and habitats.
Author:
massinissa

    • setAssignedAnimalToken

      void setAssignedAnimalToken(AnimalToken token)
      Sets the animalToken in the tile
      Parameters:
      token - the animal token that is getting assigned to the tile

    • hasAnimalToken

      boolean hasAnimalToken()
      checks if the tile has a token
      Returns:
      true if the tile has an animal token , false if not

    • createTileBag

      static List<Tile> createTileBag(TileType type)
      Creates a bag of tiles based on the specified tile type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the tile to create, either square or hexagonal.
      Returns:
      A list of Tile objects, shuffled and ready for gameplay.

    • createHexagonalTileBag

      static List<Tile> createHexagonalTileBag(String filePath)
      Creates a bag of hexagonal tiles from a file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The file containing tile data.
      Returns:
      A list of hexagonal Tile objects.

    • printTuileNull

      static String printTuileNull()
      Returns a string representation of a null tile that we need in board.
      Returns:
      a string representing the null tile.

    • supportsRotation

      default boolean supportsRotation()
      Only the Hexagonal tile supports Rotation
      Returns:
      false

    • rotateClockwise

      default void rotateClockwise()
      Only the Hexagonal tile supports Rotation Rotates the tile clockwise.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - If rotation is not supported.

    • rotateCounterClockwise

      default void rotateCounterClockwise()
      Only the Hexagonal tile supports Rotation Rotates the tile clockwise.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - If rotation is not supported.

    • hasNatureIcon

      boolean hasNatureIcon()
      checks if a tile is (ideal) which means it has a nature icon
      Returns:
      true if yes , false if not

    • getRotatedHabitats

      default List<Habitat> getRotatedHabitats()
      Only the Hexagonal tile supports Rotation Gets the habitats state of the tile after rotation
      Returns:
      list of habitats state of the tile after rotation in a
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - If rotation is not supported.
